Question Text: Among the following species, the metal center that has the highest number of unpaired electrons is ______.
Explanation: VCl4â€‹ has a vanadium atom in a +4 oxidation state with d1 configuration, leading to the highest number of unpaired electrons. The other complexes have fully paired d-orbitals or no unpaired electrons.
Subject: Chemistry

Question Text: The value of the integral $\int_{0}^{4} (x - f(x)) \, dx$, where $f(x) = \begin{cases} 0, & 0 \le x < 1 \\ 1, & 1 \le x < 2 \\ 2, & 2 \le x < 3 \\ 3, & 3 \le x < 4 \\ 4, & x = 4 \end{cases}$, is \underline{\hspace{1cm}}.
Explanation: Compute âˆ«(xâˆ’f(x))dx in segments and sum the results. After integration and substitution, the value is 2.
Subject: Mathematics

Question Text: The curve $y = x^4 - 4x^3 + 4x^2 - 4$ has tangents parallel to the $x$-axis at the following points $(x,y)$ \underline{\hspace{1cm}}.
Explanation: Tangents are parallel to the x-axis when the slope (dy/dx) is zero. Solving the derivative of y = xâ´ - 4xÂ³ + 4xÂ² - 4 gives the critical points (0, -4), (2, -4), and (1, -3).
Subject: Mathematics

Question Text: If \begin{bmatrix} x & y \\ p & q \\ u & v \end{bmatrix} R = \begin{bmatrix} 0 & 0 & 0 \\ 0 & 0 & 0 \\ 0 & 0 & 1 \end{bmatrix}, then the order of the matrix R is:
Explanation: The matrix R has 3 rows and 3 columns. Therefore, the order of R is 3Ã—3.
Subject: Mathematics

Question Text: The orbital angular momentum of a hydrogen atom in the ground state is ________.
Explanation: For the ground state, the angular momentum quantum number $l=0$. Using $L = \sqrt{l(l+1)}\hbar$, the angular momentum is $0$.
Subject: Chemistry

Question Text: The example of substrate-level phosphorylation in glycolysis is:
Option D: Conversion of Dihydroxyacetone phosphate to Glyceraldehyde-3-phosphate
Explanation: Substrate-level phosphorylation is the direct synthesis of ATP from ADP using a high-energy intermediate. In glycolysis, this occurs during the conversion of 1,3-Bisphosphoglycerate to 3-Phosphoglycerate by phosphoglycerate kinase and duting conversion of phosphoenolpyruvate to pyruvate by pyruvate kinase. These steps transfer a phosphate group directly to ADP, forming ATP.
Subject: Biochemistry

Question Text: The dipeptide with least rotational barrier in the peptide bond is:
Explanation: OptionD consists of two glycines. Glycine, being the smallest amino acid has the least rotational barrier and therefore has the greatest allowed region in the Ramachandran plot as well.
Subject: Biochemistry

Question Text: Match the given vitamins in Column I with the related proteins in Column II.
Has Image:
| Column I | Column II |
| :--- | :--- |
| a) Vitamin C | 1) Thrombin |
| b) Vitamin K | 2) Rhodopsin |
| c) Vitamin A | 3) Pyruvate dehydrogenase |
| d) Vitamin $B_1$ | 4) Prolyl hydroxylase |
Explanation: Vitamin C (a-4) acts as a cofactor for prolyl hydroxylase in collagen biosynthesis. Vitamin K (b-1) is essential for thrombin activity. Vitamin A (c-2) is part of rhodopsin, crucial for vision. Vitamin B1 (d-3) acts as a coenzyme for pyruvate dehydrogenase.
Subject: Biochemistry

Question Text: Match the protein elution condition given in Group I with the appropriate chromatography matrices from Group II
Has Image:
| Group I (Elution Condition) | Group II (Chromatography Matrix) |
| :--- | :--- |
| **P:** Increasing concentration of sodium chloride | **iii:** DEAE-Sephacryl |
| **Q:** Increasing concentration of histidine | **iv:** Ni-NTA |
| **R:** Decreasing concentration of ammonium sulfate | **i:** Phenyl-Sepharose |
| **S:** Decreasing concentration of H$^+$ | **ii:** Chromatofocusing |
Explanation: - P: Increasing concentration of sodium chloride â†’ DEAE-Sephacryl (iii): Ion-exchange chromatography uses increasing ionic strength for elution. - Q: Increasing concentration of histidine â†’ Ni-NTA (iv): Affinity chromatography elutes His-tagged proteins using histidine. - R: Decreasing concentration of ammonium sulfate â†’ Phenyl-Sepharose (i): Hydrophobic interaction chromatography elutes proteins by reducing salt concentration. - S: Decreasing concentration of Hâº â†’ Chromatofocusing (ii): pH gradients elute proteins based on isoelectric points.
Subject: Biochemistry

Question Text: The most abundant type of RNA in a metabolically active mammalian cell is
Explanation: rRNA (ribosomal RNA) constitutes the majority of total RNA in cells as it is a key component of ribosomes and is involved in protien synthesis (1 mRNA has multiple rRNAs working on trnaslating it). mRNA and tRNA are essential but less abundant. snoRNA (small nucleolar RNA) functions in RNA processing and modification.
Subject: Biochemistry

Explanation: Matched by standard qualitative test associations.
Subject: Biochemistry

Question Text:
The geometry of Fe(CO)â‚… is
(Given: Atomic number of Fe = 26)
Explanation: Fe(CO)â‚… adopts a trigonal bipyramidal geometry due to the arrangement of the five CO ligands around the iron center, with two axial and three equatorial positions, minimizing electron repulsion and achieving stability.
Subject: Chemistry
